intro: Wulfeniopsis, commonly known as the rock orchid, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the orchid family, Orchidaceae. These plants are characterized by their compact growth habit and showy, often fragrant flowers. They are typically found in rocky or mountainous habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. Wulfeniopsis species are native to various regions in the Americas, particularly in South America. Their unique floral structures and adaptability to harsh environments make them an interesting subject for botanical study.
